intro: Senecio medius, commonly known as the African snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate appearance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
